data.title: House of the Dragon: Green and Black Members Explained
data.meta_description: War is coming, who's on Rhaenyra's side and Aegon's?
data.text:
Spoilers below.

Civil war has been unfolding throughout the first two seasons of House of the Dragon, and it will all finally come to a head in season 3 (or so we hope). Over the past several episodes, both sides of the divided House Targaryen, the greens, supporting King Aegon, and the blacks, supporting Queen Rhaenyra, have sought out allies, armies, and even a few new dragonriders around Westeros. So where does everyone stand? Here, we track the key players of the greens and blacks, as well as those who have sworn loyalty to them—for now.

Team Black

Queen Rhaenyra Targaryen: heir to the Iron Throne, Princess of Dragonstone, daughter of Aemma Arryn and King Viserys I Targaryen

Dragon: Syrax

Daemon Targaryen: king consort, husband, and uncle of Rhaenyra, and brother to the late Viserys

Dragon: Caraxes

Jacaerys Velaryon: Rhaenyra and Laenor Velaryon’s oldest son and heir

Dragon: Vermax

Joffrey Velaryon: Rhaenyra and Laenor’s third son

Dragon: Tyraxes

Baela Targaryen: daughter of Daemon Targaryen and Laena Velaryon

Dragon: Moondancer

Rhaena Targaryen: daughter of Daemon Targaryen and Laena Velaryon, sister of Baela

Aegon III Targaryen: son of Rhaenyra and Daemon

Dragon: Stormcloud

Viserys II Targaryen: son of Rhaenyra and Daemon

Corlys Velaryon: a.k.a. the “Sea Snake,” Rhaenyra’s Hand of the Queen, Lord of the Tides, Master of Driftmark, and husband of Rhaenys

Mysaria: a.k.a. the “White Worm,” former lover of Daemon, Rhaenyra’s unofficial mistress of whisperers

Lord Bartimos Celtigar: lord of Claw Isle and a member of Rhaenyra’s council

Ser Lorent Marbrand: knight from House Marbrand and member of the Queensguard

Maester Gerardys: a maester on Rhaenyra’s black council

Alyn of Hull: bastard son of Corlys Velaryon, a sea captain

Addam of Hull: bastard son of Corlys Velaryon, Alyn’s brother, and a new dragonrider

Dragon: Seasmoke

Hugh Hammer: a blacksmith in King’s Landing and new dragonrider, said to be the bastard child of Saera Targaryen

Dragon: Vermithor

Ulf: a barkeep in King’s Landing and new dragonrider, claims to be the bastard son of Baelon Targaryen

Dragon: Silverwing

Simon Strong: the castellan of Harrenhal and granduncle of Larys Strong

Cregan Stark: Lord of Winterfell, ally of Rhaenyra who promised 2,000 men to her cause

Jeyne Arryn: Lady of the Eyrie, pledged her support to Rhaenyra in exchange for a dragon to guard the Vale

Oscar Tully and the Riverlords: Oscar Tully is the Lord Paramount of the Riverlands; the Riverlords report to him. He pledges his support to Rhaenyra to honor his father’s vow to Viserys.

House Frey: After meeting with Jacaerys, the Freys side with the blacks and allow passage to the Stark army to fight for Rhaenyra.

Rhaenys Targaryen (deceased): a.k. a. “The Queen Who Never Was,” the granddaughter of King Jaehaerys I Targaryen and wife of Corlys Velaryon

Dragon: Meleys (deceased)

Ser Erryk Cargyll (deceased): a member of the Kingsguard and twin brother of Arryk

Ser Steffon Darklyn (deceased): Lord Commander of the Queensguard and member of the black council

Willem Blackwood (deceased): member of House Blackwood who’s loyal to Rhaenyra and Daemon

Team Green

King Aegon II Targaryen: rival claimant to Rhaenyra, his half-sister; oldest son of Viserys and Alicent Hightower

Dragon: Sunfyre

Queen Alicent Hightower: mother of Aegon II, wife of the late King Viserys I

Aemond Targaryen: the Prince Regent ruling in his brother Aegon’s stead after he was injured in battle; son of Alicent and Viserys

Dragon: Vhagar

Ser Criston Cole: Lord Commander of the Kingsguard and Aegon’s Hand of the King

Helaena Targaryen: daughter of Alicent and Viserys and wife to Aegon II

Dragon: Dreamfyre

Ser Otto Hightower: father of Alicent Hightower; grandfather of Aegon II, Helaena, and Aemond Targaryen; Aegon’s former Hand of the King

Larys Strong: Lord of Harrenhal and master of whisperers on the green council; ally of Alicent and Aegon

Princess Jaehaera Targaryen: daughter of Aegon II and Helaena

Ser Gwayne Hightower: brother of Alicent and son of Otto Hightower

Ser Tyland Lannister: Aegon’s master of coin on the green council

Lord Jasper Wylde: Lord of Rain House and Aegon’s master of laws on the green council

Grand Maester Orwyle: the grand maester on Aegon’s green council

Lord Jason Lannister: Lord of Casterly Rock and twin brother of Tyland

Daeron Targaryen: the youngest son of Alicent and Viserys, who has been squiring in Old Town. He’s seen flying with the Hightower armies into battle.

Dragon: Tessarion

Sharako Lohar and the Triarchy: Lohar is the admiral of the Triarchy fleet, who agrees to sail on behalf of the greens after some convincing by Tyland Lannister.

House Lefford: a house sworn to House Lannister; their armies, sporting blue, are spotted marching with Lannister forces in the season 2 finale.

Lord Borros Baratheon: Lord of Storm’s End; Aemond offers his betrothal to one of his daughters for his alliance to the Greens.

Ser Arryk Cargyll (deceased): member of the Kingsguard, loyal to Aegon

Prince Jaehaerys Targaryen (deceased): son of Aegon II and Helaena, slain by Blood and Cheese

This story will be updated.
